Job Title: Data Governance Specialist

Location: Greater Philadelphia

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Information Technology

Description:
Data Governance Specialist (hybrid)
Tandigm Health, a transformational leader in population health management, is looking for a Data Governance Specialist in the greater Philadelphia area. We offer a competitive compensation and benefits package and are proud to share a culture of diversity and inclusion.
Join our team as a Data Governance Specialist! Tandigm Health is seeking a dynamic individual to fill the role of Data Governance Specialist and drive the appropriate understanding and utilization of our data assets. In this role, you will play a key role in advancing our data governance goals. You will collaborate across all business areas to establish and implement data policies, processes, and training initiatives. Your responsibilities will include organizing our data catalog, mapping data lineage, and improving data quality. Additionally, you will classify data based on its sensitivity, importance, and regulatory requirements, ensuring compliance and accountability.
Reporting to the Enterprise Data Governance Manager, you will work closely with business leadership, IT, compliance, privacy, legal, and information security teams. Your proactive approach to fostering a data-driven culture will be instrumental in driving organizational success. To excel in this role, you must possess a solid understanding of data management, privacy, security, and governance frameworks. Your ability to bridge the gap between business and technical requirements will be crucial in driving value from our data assets.  
If you are ready to make a meaningful impact and help shape the future of data governance at Tandigm, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity today! ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSData Governance Framework; support the development and implementation of a comprehensive data governance framework aligned with organizational strategic goals and industry best practices. Establish data governance policies, standards, and procedures to ensure consistency and compliance across the organization.Collaborate with business and data/technical teams on data sourcing, catalogues, dictionaries, and lineage mapping exercises.Metadata Management; work closely with IT to oversee the development and maintenance of metadata to enhance understanding of datasets. Ensure the availability and accessibility of metadata to support data lineage and relationships.Data Quality; partner with various stakeholders to enhance data quality through establishing data quality standards and monitoring data activities. Collaborate with business and IT teams to remediate data quality issues and implement preventive measures.Data Classification and Security; work closely with information security team to implement data classification policies to categorize data based on sensitivity and regulatory requirements. Collaborate with information security teams to enforce data security measures and ensure compliance with data protection regulations.Data Privacy and Compliance; stay informed about data protection laws and regulations and ensure that data governance practices comply with these requirements. Collaborate with legal, compliance and privacy teams to address privacy concerns and implement data privacy measures.Data Stewardship; partner with business leaders to identify and assign data stewards responsible for overseeing the quality and integrity of specific data domains. Collaborate with business units to define data ownership, responsibilities, and accountability.Change Management; initiate change management processes to ensure that data governance policies and practices are effectively communicated and adopted across the organization.Design and configure Collibra asset models, communities, custom views and custom workflows.Design Data Governance processes and model them in Collibra.Act as a subject matter expert in Collibra. Train and educate other business users on utilizing and interacting with Collibra.Drive continuous improvement efforts, monitor ongoing results, define process areas for review, and conduct benchmarking activities to ensure best in class results for data management best practices.Consistently exhibits behavior and communication skills that demonstrate Tandigm Health’s commitment to superior customer service, including quality, care and concern with each and every internal and external customer.Uses, protects, and discloses Tandigm’s patients’ protected health information (PHI) only in accordance with Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) standards and protects Tandigm assets from unauthorized access, disclosure, modification, destruction or interference.Adheres to and responsible to abide by all information security policies, processes, and/or activities.Performs additional duties as assigned.


Required Qualifications:
EDUCATIONBachelor’s degree from a four-year collegeMBA preferred 
EXPERIENCE5-7 years’ experience working in a data governance or related role3-5 years hands on experience with operating and configuring CollibraAbility to create/manage communities, domains, assets (business, data, compliance, technology), relationships and dashboards within CollibraHands on experience with data profiling, data cataloging, data quality, business rule definition/data quality rule definitionHealthcare industry experience preferredStrong understanding of business processes and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutionsHas worked with cross functional teams to triage and resolve data issuesDeep understanding of standards, policies and expectations regarding the availability and quality of dataStrong consulting and interpersonal skills; able to interface with all levels of the organization and tailor communication appropriatelyExcellent communicator, negotiator and collaborator with various business stakeholders driving towards decision-makingSkilled at work session facilitation, team management and cross-functional collaborationExperience with project management preferredCertifications in data management related field a plus 
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIESStrong business acumen - ability to understand key business drivers and work with leadership team to drive resultsA drive to learn and master new technologies and techniquesA self-starter who is also a team player with demonstrated abilities to collaborate effectively across the businessAbility to work independently and produce high quality work products on timeFlexibility to adjust to working on multiple initiatives, shifting priorities, ambiguity, and rapid changeExcellent written and verbal communication skillsCustomer-service oriented; responsive and respectful to colleagues, clients, patients, and providersAnalytical and problem-solving skillsIntermediate to advanced level Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint skills
 
COVID-19 Requirements: Candidates will be required to show proof of being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 upon commencing employment. Reasonable accommodations will be considered on a case-by-case basis for exemptions to this requirement in accordance with applicable law. 
Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO):Tandigm provides Equal Employment Opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. 
Search Firm Representatives Please Read Carefully:Tandigm Health, LLC does not accept unsolicited assistance from search firms for employment opportunities. All CVs/resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at our company without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of our company. No fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by our company as a result of an agency referral where no pre-existing agreement is in place. Where agency agreements are in place, introductions are position specific. Please, no phone calls or emails.

Experience Level (if available): Associate
